Dear Amanda Garza:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately,
please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff at facility restrained a youth which is inconsistent with their
policies.
Investigation On 04/13/2023 the SIR was initiated via an on-site visit to the
facility. Upon arrival, a meeting occurred with the Chief
Administrator (CA). She confirmed that the facility currently has
four youth. She advised that she was not present when the
incident occurred at the facility, but that she has reviewed the
video and confirmed that a restraint did occur. CA also provided a
copy of the restraint policy for review.
On 04/13/2023 the complainant was met with in-person. There
were no additional concerns noted.
On 04/13/2023 an onsite interview occurred with Youth A at
Footprints. Youth A reported that there was a dispute between
her and Youth B regarding a tube of lip gloss. She recalled that
Youth B seemed to be really upset and defensive about the lip
gloss and was becoming aggressive with her because Staff 2 had
been told that Youth B took the lip gloss without permission.
Youth A reported that Youth B was told to go to her room by Staff
1 and Staff 2, but she refused. She reported that Youth B then
came around Staff 1 and began beating on the cupboard and
yelling at her. Youth A stated she then started heading toward her
room. She denied that she saw either Staff 1 or Staff 2 restrain
Youth B but stated that she knew that were trying to calm her
down and keep her from trying to attack her. Youth A denied that
she has ever been restrained at the facility and denied ever
seeing staff restrain another youth.
On 04/13/2023 CA provided a copy of the video of the incident for
review. The video was dated for 04/10/2023 and began at around
8:44 pm. The video shows Youth A in the kitchen area by the
cabinet and then Youth B is seen coming to the same area,
followed by Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth B is seen slamming the
cabinet door on Youth A. Staff 1 is seen escorting Youth A out of
the kitchen and out of the view of the camera. Staff 2 is seen
restraining Youth B using her arms and body to prevent her from
leaving the kitchen. Youth B is eventually able to get away and is
seen leaving the kitchen area. Youth B returns to the kitchen view
of the camera about 30 seconds later and appears to be still
2

upset. Staff 2 is then seen holding Youth 2 in a bear hug manner
to prevent her from exiting the kitchen again. Staff 1 has now
returned to the kitchen area and appears to be attempting to talk
to Youth B. Staff 2 lets Youth B go and she is seen walking
toward the back door. The video ends and is about 3 minutes in
length.
On 04/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
Footprints. Staff 1 reported that she is employed in the capacity of
a Youth Advisor and has been employed with the agency for two
years. Staff 1 advised that there was some confusion between
Youth A and Youth B about a tube of lip gloss. She reported that
Youth B became very defensive and ended up being very angry
about being accused of taking the lip gloss without permission.
She recalled that she and Staff 2 were attempting to discuss the
issue with Youth B and she escalated and went to the kitchen
area to confront Youth A. Staff 1 recalled that it happened very
quickly. Youth B went and got into the face of Youth A and was
yelling and cursing. Staff 1 stated that she helped to escort Youth
A out of the kitchen and into her room and was able to see that
Staff 2 was “holding” Youth B back. Staff 1 confirmed that the
agency policy is not to engage in restraints. She further confirmed
that she has not been trained in how to perform a restraint. Staff 1
also denied that she has restrained any youth at Footprints in the
past. She stated that the youth normally respond very well to de-
escalation and redirection.
On 04/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Footprints. She reported that she is employed as a Youth Advisor
and has been employed with the agency since January 2023.
She further reported that this is her second time working for the
agency. Staff 2 also shared that there was a discrepancy
between Youth A and Youth B regarding some lip gloss. Staff had
found Youth B with the lip gloss, and she became upset when
Staff 1 and Staff 2 began to discuss the issue with her and
advised there would be consequences. Staff 2 reported that
Youth B began to yell and curse and stated that Youth A gave her
the lip gloss. Youth B then began to walk behind Youth A, yelling
and cursing at her. Staff 2 reported that staff were attempting to
redirect and deescalate Youth B without success. Youth B goes
into the kitchen where Youth A is and Staff 2 reported that Youth
B goes under her arms (as she is trying to block her from Youth A)
and began to charge toward Youth A. Staff 2 reported that this is
when she engaged Youth B in a bear hug to allow Youth A to go
safely to her room. Staff 2 admitted that the agency policy does
not allow for restraints and confirmed that she has not been
3

trained in properly restraining youth. She denied that she has
restrained any youth in the program before.
On 04/25/2023 a video interview was completed with Youth B.
Youth B reported that she does not recall a lot of what happened.
She reported that she was “so mad” and she “blacked out”. She
reported that she recalled that both Staff 1 and Staff 2 were trying
to stop her from getting to Youth A. She stated that she would
agree that she was restrained by Staff 2 on 4/25/23. Youth B
denied that she has been restrained by other staff on any other
occasion since being in the program. She also denied seeing staff
restrain other youth. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility
and feels she receives the services and treatment that she needs.
The following items were reviewed as a part of the special
investigation:
• Face sheets for all four-youth placed in the program.
• Footprints Restraint policy that documents the agency will
not utilize restraint or seclusion for youth placed in the
program.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule R400.4109 (1)(c). The
agency has a current policy that documents the agency will not
utilize restraint for youth placed in the program. Staff are trained
in CPI for de-escalation purposes. All staff and youth interviewed
as well as video confirmed that a restraint occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the that the current license status be continued.
